alert.note: Alert for Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; James City; Newport News; Surry; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 5:35PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Isle of Wight, southeastern York, southeastern James City and northeastern Surry Counties, the City of Poquoson, the City of Hampton and the City of Newport News through 615 PM EDT... At 534 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Surry, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Hampton, Smithfield, Surry, Langley AFB, Hampton University, Christopher Newport University, Patrick Henry Field, Seaford, Northampton, Busch Gardens, Rescue, Tabb, Beaconsdale, Scotland, Buckroe Beach, Grand View, Lee Hall, Denbigh and Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; James City; Newport News; Surry; York
